meanings.definition: Of or relating to a quarrel or fight.
meanings.sent1: The tussal argument between the siblings ended with a hug.
meanings.sent2: The tussal nature of the debate was evident from the raised voices.
meanings.sent3: The tussal disagreement over the last cookie was quickly resolved.
meanings.sent4: The tussal atmosphere in the room could be cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The tussal tension between the two teams was palpable.

meanings.sent1: The tussal between the neighbors was about the property line.
meanings.sent2: The siblings got into a tussal over who would get the bigger room.
meanings.sent3: The tussal at the town meeting was surprisingly civil.
meanings.sent4: The tussal between the students was finally settled by the teacher.
meanings.sent5: The tussal between the cats over the toy was amusing to watch.

meanings.definition: To engage in a physical struggle or fight.
meanings.sent1: The two wrestlers tussaled fiercely on the mat.
meanings.sent2: The kids tussaled playfully in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The siblings tussaled over the TV remote.
meanings.sent4: The dogs tussaled over the bone in the backyard.
meanings.sent5: The knights tussaled bravely in the tournament.
